title: Possible side effects of COVID-19 VACCINE | Bangkok Hospital
description: Fever (within 48 hours), mild headache, muscle pain or body ache
cleaned_text: Possible side effects of COVID-19 VACCINE 1 minute(s) read Share Possible side effects of COVID-19 VACCINE Mild to moderate symptoms Fever (within 48 hours), mild headache, muscle pain or body ache - Drink plenty of water. - Antipyretic and pain killer drugs e.g. paracetamol can be taken as instructed. Nausea or vomiting - Oral dehydration solution might be taken to relieve weakness caused by vomiting Pain, swelling, redness and warmth at the injection site - A cold compression is advised. - If symptoms persist, pain killer drugs can be taken as instructed. Serious symptoms Fever (within 48 hours), mild headache, muscle pain or body ache - Drink plenty of water. - Antipyretic and pain killer drugs e.g. paracetamol can be taken as instructed. Chest discomfort or breathing difficulties Severe headache Stroke-like symptoms e.g. lip drooping and leg or arm weakness Bruises or bleeding spots Skin rash Vomiting (more than 5 times within 24 hours) Seizure or unconsciousness **In case that any serious symptom exhibits, immediate medical attention is needed. For more information, please contact Internal Medicine Clinic 1st floor, Bangkok Hospital Open Daily 06.00 am. - 08.00 pm. Share
